basics.name: Nizar Khalife Iglesias
basics.label: Web developer
basics.summary: My name is Nizar and I'm a Web developer. I write software for the server, command-line and browser. I also help organize a Node.js meetup in South Florida. I try to be polite, funny and empathetic.

work.summary: Designed and developed an iOS app that enabled the use of iPod touches as low-power recording devices that record on a configurable schedule and send the recordings to a server via antenna for audio analysis. As a research assistant I also supported my colleagues in solving problems in other areas of the project such as databases, version control, server scripting and configuration.
highlights: Developed an iOS app that enabled recording of animals in the wild
Wrote comprehensive app user guide for biologists
Introduced version control (Subversion) into the team's workflow

work.company: Technology Division - University of Puerto Rico
work.summary: Added and edited content in the university's Web site. Developed my first two real Web applications in a voting system for student council elections and a public campus crime log (both using PHP and MySQL)
highlights: Developed voting system for student body council
Developed public campus crime log that is still in use today (http://uprrp.edu/crimelog/)
First experiments with raw browser HTTP requests and DOM APIs
